Scales

Module Summary

Module with code related to musical scales.

Imports

datahelper: Import json data getter.

intervals: Import Intervals class and related functions.

notes: Import Note class and related functions.

Global variables

scales.SCALE_NAMES_INTERVALS: list[str]

Contains strings of chord names and intervals (e.g.: “C (I III V)”).

scales.SCALE_NOTES: list[str]

Contains strings of chord notes (e.g.: “C E G”).

Functions

get_scale_names(): Return a ScaleNames object.

get_scale_notes(): Return a ScaleNotes object.

get_scale_intervals(): Return a ScaleIntervals object.

get_scale(): Return a full Scale object.

scale_input(): Handle the input of a scale.

display_scale_information(): Display all information on a scale.

run(): Run module as a script.

Classes

ScaleNames: Class pertaining to scale names.

ScaleIntervals: Class pertaining to scale intervals.

ScaleNotes: Class pertaining to scale notes.

Scale: Class containing all scale components.

Functions

scales.get_scale_names(scale_notes: str) → ScaleNames

Get scale names based on a string of notes.

First declares an empty list of names, initializes a counter for indexing and copies SCALE_NOTES to a variable. Afterwards, iterates through that variable and checks if the string of notes matches the current item, then uses the index counter to get the corresponding name in SCALE_NAMES_INTERVALS, splits it to separate the name from the intervals and appends it to the name list. Finally, returns a ScaleNames object with the list.

Parameters:

scale_notes (str) – The notes of the scale as a string.

Returns:

An object containing the names.

Return type:

ScaleNames

scales.get_scale_notes(scale_name: str) → ScaleNotes

Get a scale’s notes using one of its names.

Iterates through a copy of data:SCALE_NAMES_INTERVALS, checking if the name argument matches the name in the item. If so, grabs the index of the item and uses it on SCALE_NOTES to get the corresponding notes. Finally, uses a list comprehension on the splitted note string to instantiate notes.Note objects for each one, and returns them all as a single ScaleNotes object.

Parameters:

scale_name (str) – One of the scale’s names.

Returns:

An object containing the notes.

Return type:

ScaleNotes

scales.get_scale_intervals(scale_notes: str) → ScaleIntervals

Get a scale’s intervals using a string of its notes.

Iterates through a copy of SCALE_NOTES and checks if the current item matches the argument of notes given. Then grabs the index of the item and uses it to retrieve the corresponding scale intervals from SCALE_NAMES_INTERVALS. Finally, uses list comprehension on the splitted intervals string to intantiate each one as a intervals.Interval object, and returns a ScaleIntervals object containing these objects.

Parameters:

scale_notes (str) – A string of the notes from the scale.

Returns:

An object containing the intervals of the scale.

Return type:

ScaleIntervals

scales.get_scale(notes_param: str) → Scale

Return a scale object.

Uses the get_scale_names(), get_scale_intervals() and get_scale_notes() to get the components of the scale, and then use said components to instantiate a Scale object.

Parameters:

notes_param (str) – A string of scale notes.

Returns:

An object representing a scale.

Return type:

Scale

scales.scale_input() → Scale

Handle the input of scales.

Returns:

An object representing a scale.

Return type:

Scale

scales.display_scale_information(scale: Scale, variants=False)

Print all information gathered on a scale.

Parameters:

  • scale (Scale) – The scale object to be used.

  • variants (bool) – Whether should be included interval variants.

scales.run()

Run the module as a script.

Classes

ScaleNames Summary

class scales.ScaleNames(names: list[str])

Contains methods related to scale names.

Attributes

items: list[str]

The names of the scale.

Methods

filter_variants(): Filter out scale variants from a name list.

get_alternative_names(): Get alternative names for the scale.

get_names_information(): Get information on the names.

__init__(names: list[str])

Instantiate a ScaleNames object.

Parameters:

names (list[str]) – Passed to items.

ScaleNames Methods

static ScaleNames.filter_variants(alternative_names: list[str]) → list[str]

Filter out the interval variants from a list of names.

Uses count(), split() and conditionals to filter based on the number of words in the names.

Parameters:

alternative_names (list[str]) – A list of scale names.

Returns:

The scale names without variants.

Return type:

list[str]

ScaleNames.get_alternative_names(notes_str: str, variants=False)

Get the alternative names for the scale.

First declares a list based on the string of notes, then iterates through it, changing places of the notes on the list using list slicing. After that, calls get_scale_names() and filters out scale variants if the right parameter is passed. Finally, sorts the items list.

Parameters:

  • notes_str (str) – A string of the notes of the scale.

  • variants (bool) – Whether the method should get scale variants.

ScaleNames.get_names_information() → str

Return a message containing the scale names.

Returns:

A message with all the object names.

Return type:

str

ScaleNotes Methods

ScaleNotes.get_notes_str()

Get a string of the notes of the scale.

Iterates through items, appending each note name to the string to be returned, then returns it.

Returns:

The string of notes.

Return type:

str

ScaleNotes.get_notes_information()

Retrieve information about the object’s notes.

Iterates through items and uses notes.all_about_note() to get the information on them.

Returns:

A message with the information.

Return type:

str

The intervals of the object.

get_intervals_information(): Return info on the items.

Instantiate a ScaleIntervals object.

ScaleIntervals Methods

ScaleIntervals.assign_notes_to_intervals(note_list: list[musicinpython.notes.Note])

Assign notes to the intervals using a list of scale notes.

Parameters:

note_list (list[notes.Note]) – List of notes of the scale.

ScaleIntervals.get_intervals_information() → str

Grab information on the intervals and return as a message.

Iterates through the intervals in items, using intervals.all_about_interval() on them and appending also the note names of each to a message, which is returned.

Returns:

Message containing information on the scale intervals.

Return type:

str
